column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Nowadays , distributed energy resources ( DER ) are leading the change in power generation as a result of the interest in renewable energy systems ( RES ) .

#Text=These DER could be connected to the utility grid or microgrids through three-phase voltage source converters ( VSCs ) , consequently , the technical requirements , which must be accomplished by the power converter and its control algorithm , are growing .
#Text=The trend in multifrequency control using vectorial complex theory has increased the possible features .
#Text=Among those possibilities , there is an useful one in power oscillations mitigation .
#Text=Nevertheless , the techniques and objectives fulfilled can vary in each application when dealing with unbalanced grids .
#Text=Basically , if the active power oscillations are reduced in the VSC AC side , the low-frequency ripples in the DC-bus will decrease .
#Text=Firstly , when low-frequency DC ripple currents flow through the DC-bus capacitor , the temperature of the passive component increases , which causes a decreasing lifetime of this component .
#Text=The batteries also suffer this problematic effect and DC microgrids converters also look for reduced voltage oscillations due to power oscillations .
#Text=Secondly , the DC bus ripple voltage can have a harmful effect on the induction machine performance characteristics as torque pulsations .

#Text=Besides , on doubly fed induction generators ( DFIGs ) for wind turbines , active power oscillations are related to electromagnetic torque ripples that increase the mechanical stress on the turbine system .
#Text=The harmonic power oscillations in three-phase three-wire AC electrical systems come from the presence of distorted or unbalanced grids .
#Text=Therefore , the control strategy aims to regulate the instantaneous active power at a constant value by injecting the suitable currents into the grid .
#Text=The current reference could be calculated by means of the active and reactive power theory , first introduced in Reference .
#Text=From that theory , many works have dealt with the regulation of active power oscillations when grid imbalances or grid faults are faced by the power converter .

#Text=However , these methodologies only remove the second harmonic power ripple due to the appearance of fundamental negative sequence ( FNS ) voltage and its interaction with the fundamental positive sequence ( FPS ) current .
#Text=In distorted grids , there are higher even harmonic power ripples due to other harmonic sequence voltages ( −5 , +7 , −11 , +13 ) .
#Text=Hence , an effective multifrequency current reference calculator is required by the algorithm to accomplish the power ripple removal .
#Text=The presented control objective has an unavoidable characteristic in three-phase three-wire systems — the elimination of active power oscillations implies more reactive power fluctuations .
#Text=Previous publications such as References claimed the elimination of both active and reactive power oscillations , simultaneously .
#Text=However , this approach in three-wire systems leads to the injection of zero-sequence currents .
#Text=Hence , the harmonic distortion in the injected current increases dramatically .
#Text=Even so , there are some works where this injection is regulated .
#Text=In Reference , two control coefficients are added to control the injection of 3rd order current harmonics , that is , zero-sequence .

#Text=Nevertheless , most case studies only consider positive and negative sequences because zero-sequence voltages of unbalanced voltage dips do not exist in three-wire systems , nor can they propagate to the secondary side of star-ungrounded or delta-connected transformers in four-wire systems .
#Text=Even for unbalanced systems with zero-sequence voltage , four-leg inverter topologies can eliminate zero-sequence current with appropriate control .
#Text=The multifrequency current reference calculator purpose , just taking into account positive and negative sequences , has been partly fulfilled for DER applications as well as DFIG ones .
#Text=Both proposals are defined in synchronous reference frames ( SRF ) , hence , coordinate transformations are required .
#Text=This implies online computation of trigonometric functions , which is usually performed through tables , increasing the memory requirements of the algorithm to get considerable accuracy .
#Text=However , they are unnecessary because the current reference calculation can be directly implemented in the stationary reference frame ( StRF ) , as Reference has shown for unbalanced grids .
#Text=However , the StRF approach has been unemployed for the multifrequency control of instantaneous power , which avoids redundant transformations for each one of the dealt harmonics .
#Text=Besides , grid frequency variations are under the scope in recent years and grid frequency offset around its nominal values decreases the quality of injected currents .
#Text=Therefore , frequency-adaptive techniques must be applied in order to accomplish the control objective of constant active power , as is shown in this paper .
#Text=From the grid code operation point of view , the injected harmonic sequence currents are limited by the total harmonic distortion ( THD ) standards .
#Text=In order to achieve standards limitations , any of the harmonic sequence currents could be set to zero or current HD minimization could be performed .
#Text=Both approaches must sacrifice the cancellation of one power ripple component , and the smallest power ripple is chosen for the optimum performance .
#Text=Therefore , the optimum current harmonics shaping is also applied in this proposal .
